author: @hotdogjoe4039
text: I have been able to create a dropdown that populates the section values that were created from a '.ini' file with ConfigParser(). The issue that I have now is that get the text from the section within the section header, I don't want this. I want to grab the key/value entries that are assigned to those sections. Is there any way to do this?       def cfg(self):         cfg = configparser.ConfigParser()   # 'URL' = section header of the '.ini' file # 'NAME' = section. This is the value you see on the dropdown list. # 'https://...' = key/value entry. This is the value that is assigned to the section (I want this value!)           cfg['URL'] = {'NAME': 'https://www.url_example.com/1',                       'NAME2': 'https://www.url_example.com/2',                       'NAME3': 'https://www.url_example.com/3'}

author: @knighthawk9833
text: Hey sentdex, I'm curious. I watched your Tkinter series before this and noted that the code for Tkinter is a bit complex and can be unwieldy at times and I downloaded your Sea of BTC app just to see how the GUI worked on my machine (I know it's several years old at this point) and I noticed the app tends to lag when you try to select options and hesitates a bit before it opens. Is that a problem inherent in Tkinter or the fact that the app actively pulls data from the web and updates every few seconds? If it's a Tkinter issue, do apps that are written with PyQt have a similar problem? And how hard would it be to write an app with the same functionality as your Tkinter app using PyQt?

author: @pavanmullapudy3571
text: Hi Sentdex:  regarding the usage of "self", I have a doubt.  why did u use  //self.styleChoice = QtGui.QLabel("Windows Vista", self)//  and why didn't you use //self.comboBox = QtGui.QComboBox(self)//  In the first line of the home method,  yo have used  //btn = QtGui.QPushButton("Quit", self)// . But further down you have used // self.btn = QtGui.QPushButton(" Download", self) //. In this second case, I have experimented with self.btn and renamed it as btn2 and the code executed just fine.   Why like this ? Where do we use self.variable and where do we use just a variable ? Can you please help. Thank You.
